page.title: 04 St.Michaels
page.content: { St.Michaels }is one of the finest churches in Britain.It was built in the 15th century and was dedicated by {David de Bernham }the Bishop of { {St.Andrews}on the 22nd of May 1242. One of the churches finest points is the beautiful window in{St.Kathrines aisle.The original stone crown above the bell tower was removed in 1821 because it was considered dilapated and dangerous.The present spire was built of laminated timber super purity aluminium. St.Michael's now belongs to the Church of Scotland and plays an active part in the local community.A fund raising scheme has recently raised a great deal of money for vital repairs to the roof. The church is open to visitors and is an important tourist attraction in the town.
